FuncDef:
The nat alarm port-number address-group disable command disables the log and trap functions for the port usage of a public address pool.
The undo nat alarm port-number address-group disable command restores the default configuration.
By default, the log and trap functions for the port usage of a public address pool are enabled.
CLIs: nat alarm port-number { log | trap } address-group disable
undo nat alarm port-number { log | trap } address-group disable

ParaDef.Info:
Enables or disables the log function of port usage of a NAT public IP address pool.
-

Enables or disables the trap function for the port usage of a public address pool.
-

Examples: [*HUAWEI-nat-instance-cpe1] nat alarm port-number log address-group disable
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To monitor the port usage of the public address pool, run the nat alarm port-number address-group disable command in the NAT instance view to control whether the device sends an alarm upon port usage threshold-crossing of the public address pool and whether the alarm is cleared when the port usage decreases to 87.5% of the alarm threshold.
Precautions
This command is applicable only to the NAT address pool in non-easy IP mode.
This command is applicable only to the VSUF-80/VSUF-160/VSUI-160-E/VSUI-400/VSUI-400-E/VSUI-400A/VSUI-400A-E/VSUI-400-S/VSUI-400A-S.
